decision_conditions: The removal of the condition would result in displacement parking onto the surrounding highway network, whilst also causing in an increase in vehicles brought about by the unrestricted nature of the resultant parking. Taken together this would increase congestion, impede the free flow of traffic, and could result inconsiderate and dangerous highway manoeuvres that would in turn cause highway safety concerns in an area well trafficked by pedestrians. The proposal would therefore by contrary to Policy CS7 and DM9 of the Kingston Core Strategy and Policy T4 and Policy T6 of the London Plan 2021.

The removal of the condition would de restrict parking in an area with good links to existing public transport, thereby failing to have regard to the need to promote active modes of transport and public transport use, contrary to Policy T6 of the London Plan 2021.

description: Removal of Condition Application under Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 to carry out development without compliance with condition 13 (Garage Use) of Planning Permission ref: 98/3381/FUL
